page.title: 02VILLAGE LIFE
page.content:
{VILLAGE LIFE IN WINESTEAD}
The general concencus of opinion is that Winestead is a nice small village to live in. It is quiet, purely rural and has more trees than most villages in the area because of the plantations. The present owners of the School House have logged 42 different species of birds which regularly visit their garden. It was thought that "Town" people should not move into villages such as Winestead as they are generally not prepared to accept the way of life, such as not having main sewerage, no street lights, no footpaths, no shops, stubble burning and the smell of fertiliser spread on the fields. No public service bus passes through Winestead, the nearest one being on the 1033 Hull to Withernsea road.
